Display Special Data Information

Source: R/wp_info.r
in_info_special.Rd

Internal function to handle special data display cases in wp_info. Currently supports Balance of Payments (BOP) data display with search and highlighting capabilities.

Usage

in_info_special(
  special,
  frequency = NULL,
  origin = NULL,
  search = NULL,
  color = TRUE,
  colors_def = NULL,
  print = TRUE
)

Arguments

special

Character string specifying the special data type (currently only "BOP" is supported)

frequency

Character, either "Q", "Y", or NULL (ignored when special is used, triggers warning)

origin

Character vector of data origins (ignored when special is used, triggers warning)

search

Character vector of search terms to filter data (searches across all columns)

color

Logical, whether to use color highlighting (default = TRUE)

colors_def

List of ANSI color codes used for highlighting search matches

print

Logical, whether to print the output to console (default = TRUE)

Value

Invisibly returns the displayed data frame

Details

This function provides specialized display formatting for different types of data. For BOP data:

  • Displays data in a formatted table with aligned columns

  • Supports text wrapping for long entries

  • Implements search across all columns

  • Provides color highlighting for search matches

  • Automatically adjusts to terminal width

The function will issue warnings if:

  • Terminal width is too narrow for proper display

  • frequency or origin parameters are provided (as they are ignored)

The function's output can be controlled via the print parameter:

  • When print=TRUE (default), displays formatted output to console

  • When print=FALSE, silently returns the filtered data

See also

wp_info

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# These are called internally by wp_info:
in_info_special("BOP", search = "Export")
in_info_special("BOP", search = c("Export", "Import"), color = TRUE)
} # }
